channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: problexity -- an open-source Python library for binary classification problem complexity assessment
item.description: This paper describes the software module that allows for the estimation of 22 complexity measures for the Python language -- compatible with the scikit-learn programming interface -- allowing for the implementation of research using them in the most popular programming environment of the machine learning community.

item.title: Multi-Level Branched Regularization for Federated Learning
item.description: A critical challenge of federated learning is data heterogeneity and imbalance across clients, which leads to inconsistency between local networks and unstable convergence of global models.

item.title: Benchmarking Omni-Vision Representation through the Lens of Visual Realms
item.description: We benchmark ReCo and other advances in omni-vision representation studies that are different in architectures (from CNNs to transformers) and in learning paradigms (from supervised learning to self-supervised learning) on OmniBenchmark.

item.title: From Shapley back to Pearson: Hypothesis Testing via the Shapley Value
item.description: In this work, we show that Shapley-based explanation methods and conditional independence testing for feature importance are closely related.

item.title: Distance Learner: Incorporating Manifold Prior to Model Training
item.description: The manifold hypothesis (real world data concentrates near low-dimensional manifolds) is suggested as the principle behind the effectiveness of machine learning algorithms in very high dimensional problems that are common in domains such as vision and speech.

item.title: Few-Shot Specific Emitter Identification via Deep Metric Ensemble Learning
item.description: Thus, we focus on few-shot SEI (FS-SEI) for aircraft identification via automatic dependent surveillance-broadcast (ADS-B) signals, and a novel FS-SEI method is proposed, based on deep metric ensemble learning (DMEL).

item.title: Reinforced Path Reasoning for Counterfactual Explainable Recommendation
item.description: We also deploy the explanation policy to a recommendation model to enhance the recommendation.

item.title: Spatiotemporal Propagation Learning for Network-Wide Flight Delay Prediction
item.description: By this means, STPN allows cross-talk of spatial and temporal factors for modeling delay propagation.

item.title: Equivariant Hypergraph Diffusion Neural Operators
item.description: Hypergraph neural networks (HNNs) using neural networks to encode hypergraphs provide a promising way to model higher-order relations in data and further solve relevant prediction tasks built upon such higher-order relations.

item.title: Dynamic Low-Resolution Distillation for Cost-Efficient End-to-End Text Spotting
item.description: In this paper, to address this problem, we propose a novel cost-efficient Dynamic Low-resolution Distillation (DLD) text spotting framework, which aims to infer images in different small but recognizable resolutions and achieve a better balance between accuracy and efficiency.

item.title: Egocentric Scene Understanding via Multimodal Spatial Rectifier
item.description: We present a multimodal spatial rectifier that stabilizes the egocentric images to a set of reference directions, which allows learning a coherent visual representation.

item.title: Parameter-Efficient Prompt Tuning Makes Generalized and Calibrated Neural Text Retrievers
item.description: By updating only 0. 1% of the model parameters, the prompt tuning strategy can help retrieval models achieve better generalization performance than traditional methods in which all parameters are updated.

item.title: Learning to translate by learning to communicate
item.description: We formulate and test a technique to use Emergent Communication (EC) with a pretrained multilingual model to improve on modern Unsupervised NMT systems, especially for low-resource languages.

item.title: Adversarial Attacks on Monocular Pose Estimation
item.description: While studies evaluating the impact of adversarial attacks on monocular depth estimation exist, a systematic demonstration and analysis of adversarial perturbations against pose estimation are lacking.

item.title: Real-time Streaming Video Denoising with Bidirectional Buffers
item.description: Recent multi-output inference works propagate the bidirectional temporal feature with a parallel or recurrent framework, which either suffers from performance drops on the temporal edges of clips or can not achieve online inference.

item.title: XMem: Long-Term Video Object Segmentation with an Atkinson-Shiffrin Memory Model
item.description: We present XMem, a video object segmentation architecture for long videos with unified feature memory stores inspired by the Atkinson-Shiffrin memory model.

item.title: Low-Precision Arithmetic for Fast Gaussian Processes
item.description: Low-precision arithmetic has had a transformative effect on the training of neural networks, reducing computation, memory and energy requirements.

item.title: PASHA: Efficient HPO with Progressive Resource Allocation
item.description: Hyperparameter optimization (HPO) and neural architecture search (NAS) are methods of choice to obtain the best-in-class machine learning models, but in practice they can be costly to run.

item.title: Temporal Action Detection with Global Segmentation Mask Learning
item.description: Existing temporal action detection (TAD) methods rely on generating an overwhelmingly large number of proposals per video.

item.title: Tree Structure-Aware Few-Shot Image Classification via Hierarchical Aggregation
item.description: To solve this problem, we present a plug-in Hierarchical Tree Structure-aware (HTS) method, which not only learns the relationship of FSL and pretext tasks, but more importantly, can adaptively select and aggregate feature representations generated by pretext tasks to maximize the performance of FSL tasks.

item.title: A Personalized Zero-Shot ECG Arrhythmia Monitoring System: From Sparse Representation Based Domain Adaption to Energy Efficient Abnormal Beat Detection for Practical ECG Surveillance
item.description: An extensive set of experiments performed on the benchmark MIT-BIH ECG dataset shows that when this domain adaptation-based training data generator is used with a simple 1-D CNN classifier, the method outperforms the prior work by a significant margin.

item.title: Prototypical Contrast Adaptation for Domain Adaptive Semantic Segmentation
item.description: Unsupervised Domain Adaptation (UDA) aims to adapt the model trained on the labeled source domain to an unlabeled target domain.

item.title: DavarOCR: A Toolbox for OCR and Multi-Modal Document Understanding
item.description: Compared with the previous opensource OCR toolbox, DavarOCR has relatively more complete support for the sub-tasks of the cutting-edge technology of document understanding.

item.title: Towards Grand Unification of Object Tracking
item.description: We present a unified method, termed Unicorn, that can simultaneously solve four tracking problems (SOT, MOT, VOS, MOTS) with a single network using the same model parameters.

item.title: Learning Implicit Templates for Point-Based Clothed Human Modeling
item.description: We present FITE, a First-Implicit-Then-Explicit framework for modeling human avatars in clothing.

item.title: Scene Text Recognition with Permuted Autoregressive Sequence Models
item.description: Context-aware STR methods typically use internal autoregressive (AR) language models (LM).

item.title: ConCL: Concept Contrastive Learning for Dense Prediction Pre-training in Pathology Images
item.description: We first benchmark representative SSL methods for dense prediction tasks in pathology images.

item.title: Octuplet Loss: Make Face Recognition Robust to Image Resolution
item.description: To address this problem, we propose a novel combination of the popular triplet loss to improve robustness against image resolution via fine-tuning of existing face recognition models.

item.title: Tackling Background Distraction in Video Object Segmentation
item.description: Semi-supervised video object segmentation (VOS) aims to densely track certain designated objects in videos.

item.title: A Multi-Modality Ovarian Tumor Ultrasound Image Dataset for Unsupervised Cross-Domain Semantic Segmentation
item.description: To solve this problem, we propose a Multi-Modality Ovarian Tumor Ultrasound (MMOTU) image dataset containing 1469 2d ultrasound images and 170 contrast enhanced ultrasonography (CEUS) images with pixel-wise and global-wise annotations.

item.title: GeoSegNet: Point Cloud Semantic Segmentation via Geometric Encoder-Decoder Modeling
item.description: Semantic segmentation of point clouds, aiming to assign each point a semantic category, is critical to 3D scene understanding. Despite of significant advances in recent years, most of existing methods still suffer from either the object-level misclassification or the boundary-level ambiguity.

item.title: ObjectBox: From Centers to Boxes for Anchor-Free Object Detection
item.description: We present ObjectBox, a novel single-stage anchor-free and highly generalizable object detection approach.

item.title: Language Modelling with Pixels
item.description: Language models are defined over a finite set of inputs, which creates a vocabulary bottleneck when we attempt to scale the number of supported languages.

item.title: Adversarial Sign-Corrupted Isotonic Regression
item.description: We develop \texttt{ASCIFIT}, a three-step estimation procedure under the \texttt{ASCI} setting.

item.title: Refign: Align and Refine for Adaptation of Semantic Segmentation to Adverse Conditions
item.description: Due to the scarcity of dense pixel-level semantic annotations for images recorded in adverse visual conditions, there has been a keen interest in unsupervised domain adaptation (UDA) for the semantic segmentation of such images.

item.title: Recurrent Memory Transformer
item.description: We implement a memory mechanism with no changes to Transformer model by adding special memory tokens to the input or output sequence.

item.title: PIAT: Physics Informed Adversarial Training for Solving Partial Differential Equations
item.description: In this paper, we propose the physics informed adversarial training (PIAT) of neural networks for solving nonlinear differential equations (NDE).

item.title: DropNet: Reducing Neural Network Complexity via Iterative Pruning
item.description: Modern deep neural networks require a significant amount of computing time and power to train and deploy, which limits their usage on edge devices.

item.title: BayesCap: Bayesian Identity Cap for Calibrated Uncertainty in Frozen Neural Networks
item.description: Moreover, many of the high-performing deep learning models that are already trained and deployed are non-Bayesian in nature and do not provide uncertainty estimates.

item.title: ReAct: Temporal Action Detection with Relational Queries
item.description: Moreover, we propose two losses to facilitate and stabilize the training of action classification.

item.title: Bootstrapped Masked Autoencoders for Vision BERT Pretraining
item.description: The first design is motivated by the observation that using a pretrained MAE to extract the features as the BERT prediction target for masked tokens can achieve better pretraining performance.

item.title: Instance Selection Mechanisms for Human-in-the-Loop Systems in Few-Shot Learning
item.description: Few-shot learning addresses this challenge and reduces data gathering and labeling costs by learning novel classes with very few labeled data.

item.title: Immunofluorescence Capillary Imaging Segmentation: Cases Study
item.description: Our work offers a benchmark dataset for training deep learning models for capillary image segmentation and provides a potential tool for future capillary research.

item.title: Sample-dependent Adaptive Temperature Scaling for Improved Calibration
item.description: The most common post-hoc approach to compensate for this is to perform temperature scaling, which adjusts the confidences of the predictions on any input by scaling the logits by a fixed value.

item.title: PointNorm: Normalization is All You Need for Point Cloud Analysis
item.description: We also generalize our model to point cloud part segmentation and demonstrate competitive performance on the ShapeNetPart dataset.

item.title: AdamNODEs: When Neural ODE Meets Adaptive Moment Estimation
item.description: In this work, we propose adaptive momentum estimation neural ODEs (AdamNODEs) that adaptively control the acceleration of the classical momentum-based approach.

item.title: Randomly pivoted Cholesky: Practical approximation of a kernel matrix with few entry evaluations
item.description: Randomly pivoted Cholesky (RPCholesky) is a natural algorithm for computing a rank-k approximation of an N x N positive semidefinite (psd) matrix.

item.title: QT-Routenet: Improved GNN generalization to larger 5G networks by fine-tuning predictions from queueing theory
item.description: To achieve this, we propose to first extract robust features related to Queueing Theory (QT), and then fine-tune the analytical baseline prediction using a modification of the Routenet Graph Neural Network (GNN) model.

item.title: CoSCL: Cooperation of Small Continual Learners is Stronger than a Big One
item.description: Continual learning requires incremental compatibility with a sequence of tasks.

item.title: Symmetry-Aware Transformer-based Mirror Detection
item.description: Mirror detection aims to identify the mirror regions in the given input image.
